fictionBooks.title: A TIME FOR MERCY
fictionBooks.author: John Grisham
fictionBooks.description: The third book in the Jake Brigance series. A 16-year-old is accused of killing a deputy in Clanton, Miss., in 1990.

fictionBooks.title: THE RETURN
fictionBooks.author: Nicholas Sparks
fictionBooks.description: A doctor serving in the Navy in Afghanistan goes back to North Carolina where two women change his life.

fictionBooks.title: THE SEARCHER
fictionBooks.author: Tana French
fictionBooks.description: After a divorce, a former Chicago police officer resettles in an Irish village where a boy goes missing.

fictionBooks.title: THE EVENING AND THE MORNING
fictionBooks.author: Ken Follett
fictionBooks.description: In a prequel to “The Pillars of the Earth,” a boatbuilder, a Norman noblewoman and a monk live in England under attack by the Welsh and the Vikings.

fictionBooks.title: THE INVISIBLE LIFE OF ADDIE LARUE
fictionBooks.author: VE Schwab
fictionBooks.description: A Faustian bargain comes with a curse that affects the adventure Addie LaRue has across centuries.

fictionBooks.title: THE BOOK OF TWO WAYS
fictionBooks.author: Jodi Picoult
fictionBooks.description: After surviving a plane crash, a death doula travels to Egypt to reconnect with an old flame who is an archaeologist.

fictionBooks.title: LEAVE THE WORLD BEHIND
fictionBooks.author: Rumaan Alam
fictionBooks.description: A family vacation in an isolated part of Long Island is thrown into confusion when the home’s owners return claiming New York City is having a blackout.

fictionBooks.title: TROUBLES IN PARADISE
fictionBooks.author: Elin Hilderbrand
fictionBooks.description: The final installment of the trilogy that includes “Winter in Paradise” and “What Happens in Paradise.”

fictionBooks.title: THE VANISHING HALF
fictionBooks.author: Brit Bennett
fictionBooks.description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

fictionBooks.title: JINGLE ALL THE WAY
fictionBooks.author: Debbie Macomber
fictionBooks.description: A December cruise in the Amazon fosters a potential change in priorities for a career-focused real-estate executive.

fictionBooks.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
fictionBooks.author: Delia Owens
fictionBooks.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

fictionBooks.title: INVISIBLE GIRL
fictionBooks.author: Lisa Jewell
fictionBooks.description: An ex-schoolteacher accused of sexual misconduct lives near a family led by a child psychologist whose former patient goes missing.

fictionBooks.title: THE COAST-TO-COAST MURDERS
fictionBooks.author: James Patterson and JD Barker
fictionBooks.description: A detective and an F.B.I. agent are baffled by a cross-country killing spree.

fictionBooks.title: ANXIOUS PEOPLE
fictionBooks.author: Fredrik Backman
fictionBooks.description: A failed bank robber holds a group of strangers hostage at an apartment open house.

fictionBooks.title: THE GUEST LIST
fictionBooks.author: Lucy Foley
fictionBooks.description: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly.

nonFictionBooks.title: CASTE
nonFictionBooks.author: Isabel Wilkerson
nonFictionBooks.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.

nonFictionBooks.title: IS THIS ANYTHING?
nonFictionBooks.author: Jerry Seinfeld
nonFictionBooks.description: The comedian shares material he collected in an accordion folder over the last 45 years.

nonFictionBooks.title: UNTAMED
nonFictionBooks.author: Glennon Doyle
nonFictionBooks.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.

nonFictionBooks.title: KILLING CRAZY HORSE
nonFictionBooks.author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
nonFictionBooks.description: The ninth book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series focuses on conflicts with Native Americans.

nonFictionBooks.title: BLACKOUT
nonFictionBooks.author: Candace Owens
nonFictionBooks.description: The conservative commentator makes her case that Black Americans should part ways with the Democratic Party.

nonFictionBooks.title: RAGE
nonFictionBooks.author: Bob Woodward
nonFictionBooks.description: Based on 17 on-the-record interviews with President Trump and other reporting, the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist details the president’s perspective on multiple crises.

nonFictionBooks.title: HUMANS
nonFictionBooks.author: Brandon Stanton
nonFictionBooks.description: Photos and stories of people from over 40 countries collected by the creator of “Humans of New York.”

nonFictionBooks.title: AMERICAN CRISIS
nonFictionBooks.author: Andrew Cuomo
nonFictionBooks.description: The New York State governor gives his perspective on the Covid-19 crisis and prescribes ways to deal with future disasters.

nonFictionBooks.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST
nonFictionBooks.author: Ibram X Kendi
nonFictionBooks.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.

nonFictionBooks.title: TEN LESSONS FOR A POST-PANDEMIC WORLD
nonFictionBooks.author: Fareed Zakaria
nonFictionBooks.description: The CNN host posits what might happen on the other side of the Covid-19 pandemic.

nonFictionBooks.title: THE MEANING OF MARIAH CAREY
nonFictionBooks.author: Mariah Carey with Michaela Angela Davis
nonFictionBooks.description: The career highlights, public life and private struggles of the singer and songwriter.

nonFictionBooks.title: TRUMPTY DUMPTY WANTED A CROWN
nonFictionBooks.author: John Lithgow
nonFictionBooks.description: A second illustrated collection of poems chronicling and satirizing current events.

nonFictionBooks.title: THE 99% INVISIBLE CITY
nonFictionBooks.author: Roman Mars and Kurt Kohlstedt
nonFictionBooks.description: A look at the design and architecture of various and sometimes unexpected elements that make cities function.

nonFictionBooks.title: ONE VOTE AWAY
nonFictionBooks.author: Ted Cruz
nonFictionBooks.description: The Republican senator from Texas gives his views on what might happen if liberals gain a simple majority on the Supreme Court.

nonFictionBooks.title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH
nonFictionBooks.author: Mary L Trump
nonFictionBooks.description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump.

personalBookList.title: A TIME FOR MERCY
personalBookList.author: John Grisham
personalBookList.description: The third book in the Jake Brigance series. A 16-year-old is accused of killing a deputy in Clanton, Miss., in 1990.

personalBookList.title: THE SEARCHER
personalBookList.author: Tana French
personalBookList.description: After a divorce, a former Chicago police officer resettles in an Irish village where a boy goes missing.
